Courtyard.io is redefining how we invest in collectibles by making it frictionless, safe, and fun. Founded in 2021 and hailing from the Y Combinator W22 batch, this San Francisco-based company is carving out a niche in the collectibles marketplace through innovative tokenization services. Their mission is straightforward: they want to enable anyone to own and trade physical collectibles seamlessly on the blockchain, which introduces greater transparency, liquidity, and a fresh form of ownership.

The focus is currently on graded cards, and they offer some exciting ways for both enthusiasts and newcomers to engage. With their slab Vending Machines and curated mystery pack Drops, Courtyard.io creates a dynamic environment where collecting becomes both an enjoyable and equitable experience. To ensure the safety and security of these collectibles, they've partnered with Brink’s, a name synonymous with security and logistics.

Courtyard.io operates with a lean team of 13 dedicated employees, and with Harj Taggar as their Group Partner, they're well-positioned to navigate the evolving landscape of collectibles investing. Their strategic approach has put them at the intersection of marketplace, sports-tech, and consumer-focused innovations, making them a noteworthy player in the San Francisco Bay Area.

If you're keen to dive into the world of collectibles with a modern twist, check them out at [courtyard.io](https://courtyard.io).
